Pre-Game Insights: Denmark and Switzerland are set to play a friendly match on March 23, 2024, at Parken Stadium in Copenhagen.
Denmark, led by Kasper Hjulmand, topped their Euro 2024 qualifying group and aim to build on their home record.
Switzerland, under Murat Yakin, seeks to improve after a disappointing qualifying campaign despite securing a spot in the finals.
Denmark's squad faces injuries with notable absences including Andreas Christensen and Andreas Skov Olsen.
Switzerland will miss Gregor Kobel, but Yann Sommer's experience provides stability in goal.
Key players for Denmark include Christian Eriksen and Rasmus Hojlund, while Switzerland will rely on Dan Ndoye and Xherdan Shaqiri.
